text:
Raskolnikov followed Svidrigaïlov. 

"What’s this?" Svidrigaïlov turned. 

"I won’t lose sight of you," Raskolnikov said. 

"Why?" 

They stared at each other, tension thick in the air. 

"You still want my sister. I know it." 

Svidrigaïlov laughed. 

"Surprised you noticed. Explain your latest theories!" 

Raskolnikov frowned. 

"I’m going home for money. Then to the Islands." 

"I’ll visit Sofya Semyonovna," Svidrigaïlov replied. 

"She’s not home. She’s with an old lady," Raskolnikov said. 

"I'll go anyway." 

"Suit yourself. I won’t join you." 

"Suspicious of me?" Svidrigaïlov smirked. 

"Delicacy teaches nothing," Raskolnikov shot back. 

"And listening at doors?"

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov confronts Svidrigaïlov about his intentions towards his sister, revealing his suspicions and protective instincts.
